f1.title: Right Triangle Area
f1.description: In a right triangle, area is half the product of the legs.

f2.title: Right Triangle Hypotenuse
f2.description: Hypotenuse in a right triangle: Pythagorean theorem.

f3.title: Equilateral Triangle Area
f3.description: In an equilateral triangle, area is one quarter of side squared times sqrt(3).

f5.title: Isosceles Triangle Area
f5.description: Area is half of base times height in an isosceles triangle.

f6.title: Side in Isosceles Triangle
f6.description: Equal side length in an isosceles triangle.

f7.title: Square Area
f7.description: Area of a square equals the square of its side.

f8.title: Square Perimeter
f8.description: Perimeter equals four times the side length.

f8a.title: Square Diagonal
f8a.description: Length of a diagonal of a square.

f8b.title: Side Length (From Area)
f8b.description: Side length when area is known.

f8c.title: Side Length (From Perimeter)
f8c.description: Side length when perimeter is known.

f8d.title: Side Length (From Diagonal)
f8d.description: Side length when diagonal is known.

f8e.title: Inradius (Inscribed Circle)
f8e.description: Radius of the circle inscribed in the square.

f8f.title: Circumradius (Circumscribed Circle)
f8f.description: Radius of the circle passing through vertices of the square.

f9.title: Rectangle Area
f9.description: Area equals product of side lengths.

f10.title: Rectangle Perimeter
f10.description: Perimeter equals sum of twice the short and long sides.

f10b.title: Side Length (From Area)
f10b.description: One side length when area and the other side are known.

f10c.title: Side Length (From Perimeter and Other Side)
f10c.description: One side length when perimeter and the other side are known.

f10d.title: Side Length (From Diagonal and Other Side)
f10d.description: One side length when diagonal and the other side are known.

f10e.title: Circumradius
f10e.description: Radius of the circle passing through rectangle's vertices.

f50.title: Parallelogram Perimeter
f50.description: Perimeter equals sum of twice the short and long sides.

f50a.title: First Diagonal Length
f50a.description: Length of the first diagonal of a parallelogram.

f50b.title: Second Diagonal Length
f50b.description: Length of the second diagonal of a parallelogram.

f50c.title: Height (From Area and Side)
f50c.description: Height when area and base are known.

f50d.title: Side Length (From Area and Height)
f50d.description: Side length when area and height are known.

f50e.title: Side Length (From Perimeter and Other Side)
f50e.description: Side length when perimeter and the other side are known.

f50f.title: Interior Angle (From Diagonals and Sides)
f50f.description: Interior angle when diagonals and sides are known.

f12.title: Trapezoid Area
f12.description: Area equals half of (sum of bases) times height.

f51.title: Trapezoid Perimeter
f51.description: Perimeter equals sum of all four sides.

f51a.title: Height (From Area and Bases)
f51a.description: Height when area and bases are known.

f51b.title: Base Length (From Area, Height, Other Base)
f51b.description: A base length from area, height and the other base.

f51c.title: Midsegment Length
f51c.description: Average of the bases in a trapezoid.

f13.title: Rhombus Area
f13.description: Area equals half the product of the diagonals.

f52.title: Rhombus Perimeter
f52.description: Perimeter equals four times the side length.

f52b.title: Height (From Area and Side)
f52b.description: Height when area and side are known.

f52c.title: Side Length (From Perimeter)
f52c.description: Side length when perimeter is known.

f52d.title: Side Length (From Diagonals)
f52d.description: Side length when diagonals are known.

f52e.title: Diagonal (From Area and Other Diagonal)
f52e.description: Diagonal length from area and the other diagonal.

f52f.title: Diagonal (From Side and Other Diagonal)
f52f.description: Diagonal length from side and the other diagonal.

f52g.title: Interior Angle (From Sides and Diagonals)
f52g.description: Interior angle when sides and diagonals are known.

f55.title: Regular n-gon Perimeter
f55.description: Perimeter equals n times side length.

f55a.title: Side Length (From Area)
f55a.description: Side length when area is known.

f55b.title: Side Length (From Perimeter)
f55b.description: Side length when perimeter is known.

f55c.title: Interior Angle
f55c.description: Each interior angle in a regular n-gon.

f55d.title: Exterior Angle
f55d.description: Each exterior angle in a regular n-gon.

f55e.title: Apothem (Height)
f55e.description: Perpendicular from center to a side (apothem).

f55f.title: Circumradius
f55f.description: Radius of the circumscribed circle of the n-gon.

f55g.title: Inradius
f55g.description: Radius of the inscribed circle of the n-gon (equals apothem).

f56.title: Sector Area
f56.description: Area of a circular sector based on central angle.

f57.title: Segment Area
f57.description: Area of a circular segment equals sector area minus triangle area.

f22.title: Cube Surface Area
f22.description: Total surface area of a cube.

f22a.title: Cube Space Diagonal
f22a.description: Length of a space diagonal of a cube.

f22d.title: Face Area of Cube
f22d.description: Area of one face of a cube.

f61.title: Rectangular Prism Surface Area
f61.description: Total surface area of a rectangular prism.

f61b.title: Edge Length (From Volume)
f61b.description: One edge length from volume and other edges.

f61c.title: Edge Length (From Surface Area and Others)
f61c.description: One edge length from surface area and other edges.

f61d.title: Base Area
f61d.description: Area of the base of the prism.

f61e.title: Lateral Surface Area
f61e.description: Sum of lateral face areas of the prism.

f25.title: Cylinder Surface Area
f25.description: Total surface area of a cylinder.

f25a.title: Cylinder Base Area
f25a.description: Area of one base of the cylinder.

f25b.title: Cylinder Lateral Area
f25b.description: Lateral surface area of the cylinder.

f25d.title: Cylinder Height (From Volume)
f25d.description: Height when volume and radius are known.

f25e.title: Cylinder Radius (From Volume)
f25e.description: Radius when volume and height are known.

f25f.title: Cylinder Radius (From Base Area)
f25f.description: Radius when base area is known.

f62b.title: Cone Lateral Area
f62b.description: Lateral surface area of the cone.

f62d.title: Cone Height (From Volume)
f62d.description: Height when volume and radius are known.

f62e.title: Cone Radius (From Volume)
f62e.description: Radius when volume and height are known.

f62f.title: Cone Radius (From Base Area)
f62f.description: Radius when base area is known.

f62g.title: Cone Slant Height
f62g.description: Slant height from radius and height.

f28c.title: Sphere Radius (From Surface Area)
f28c.description: Radius when surface area is known.

f28d.title: Spherical Segment Volume
f28d.description: Volume of a spherical segment of height h.

f28e.title: Spherical Section Area
f28e.description: Area of a circular section of a sphere.

f30.title: Circle Equation
f30.description: Equation of a circle in analytic geometry.

f31.title: Parabola Equation
f31.description: Equation of a parabola in analytic geometry.

f32.title: Ellipse Equation
f32.description: Equation of an ellipse in analytic geometry.

f33.title: Hyperbola Equation
f33.description: Equation of a hyperbola in analytic geometry.

f40.title: Exponentiation
f40.description: A number raised to a power.

f41.title: Sine in Right Triangle
f41.description: Sine equals opposite leg over hypotenuse.

f42.title: Cosine in Right Triangle
f42.description: Cosine equals adjacent leg over hypotenuse.

f43.title: Tangent in Right Triangle
f43.description: Tangent equals opposite leg over adjacent leg.

f44.title: Euclid Relation in Right Triangle
f44.description: Relation between altitude and projections in a right triangle.

f45.title: Interior Angle of Equilateral Triangle
f45.description: Each interior angle is 60Â° in an equilateral triangle.

f46.title: Perimeter of Equilateral Triangle
f46.description: Perimeter equals thrice the side length.

f47.title: Base Angle in Isosceles Triangle
f47.description: Base angles are equal in an isosceles triangle.

f48.title: Perimeter of Isosceles Triangle
f48.description: Perimeter equals sum of two equal sides and the base.

f49.title: Perimeter of Right Triangle
f49.description: Perimeter equals sum of the three sides.

f58.title: Central Angle in Circle
f58.description: Central angle equals arc length over radius.

f59.title: Tangent Length in Circle
f59.description: Length of a tangent from a point to a circle.

f60.title: Secant Length in Circle
f60.description: Product of secant segments from an external point is constant.

f63.title: Distance Between Two Points
f63.description: Distance between two points in the plane.

f64.title: Distance from Point to Line
f64.description: Perpendicular distance from a point to a line.

f66.title: Midpoint
f66.description: Coordinates of the midpoint between two points.
